1.name: Double Indemnity
1.description: An insurance representative lets himself be talked by a seductive housewife into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of an insurance investigator.

2.name: Meet Me in St. Louis
2.description: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love, even as they prepare for a reluctant move to New York.

3.name: Gaslight
3.description: Years after her aunt was murdered in her home, a young woman moves back into the house with her new husband. However, he has a secret that he will do anything to protect, even if it means driving his wife insane.

4.name: Arsenic and Old Lace
4.description: A drama critic learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are homicidal maniacs, and that insanity runs in his family.

5.name: To Have and Have Not
5.description: During World War II, American expatriate Harry Morgan helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.

6.name: Laura
6.description: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

7.name: Lifeboat
7.description: Several survivors of a torpedoed merchant ship in World War II find themselves in the same lifeboat with one of the U-boat men who sunk it.

8.name: The Uninvited
8.description: A composer and his sister discover that the reason they are able to purchase a beautiful gothic seacoast mansion very cheaply is the house's unsavory past.

9.name: The Woman in the Window
9.description: When a conservative middle-aged professor engages in a minor dalliance with a femme fatale, he is plunged into a nightmarish quicksand of blackmail and murder.

10.name: Going My Way
10.description: Father Charles O'Mailey, a young priest at a financially failing Church in a tough neighborhood, gains support and inspires his superior.

11.name: House of Frankenstein
11.description: An evil scientist and his hunchbacked assistant escape from prison and encounter Dracula, the Wolf Man and Frankenstein's Monster.

12.name: Ivan Groznyy
12.description: During the early part of his reign, Ivan the Terrible faces betrayal from the aristocracy and even his closest friends as he seeks to unite the Russian people.

13.name: National Velvet
13.description: A jaded former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.

14.name: The Fighting Seabees
14.description: During WW2, the U.S. Navy implements a new idea of forming construction battalions that also are fighting units, in case of Japanese attack.

15.name: Buffalo Bill
15.description: The story of William "Buffalo Bill" Cody, legendary westerner, from his days as an army scout to his later activities as owner of a Wild West show.

16.name: The Three Caballeros
16.description: Donald receives his birthday gifts, which include traditional gifts and information about Brazil (hosted by Zé Carioca) and Mexico (by Panchito, a Mexican Charro Rooster).

17.name: The Curse of the Cat People
17.description: The young, friendless daughter of Oliver and Alice Reed befriends her father's dead first wife and an aging, reclusive actress.

18.name: Captain America
18.description: Superhero Captain America battles the evil forces of the archvillain called The Scarab, who poisons his enemies and steals a secret device capable of destroying buildings by sound vibrations.

19.name: Since You Went Away
19.description: With her husband away to fight in World War II, a housewife struggles to care for their two daughters - and a pair of lodgers who have moved in - alone.

20.name: Murder, My Sweet
20.description: After being hired to find an ex-con's former girlfriend, Philip Marlowe is drawn into a deeply complex web of mystery and deceit.

21.name: The Mummy's Curse
21.description: An irrigation project in the rural bayous of Louisiana unearths living mummy Kharis, who was buried in quicksand twenty-five years earlier.

22.name: The Chronicle History of King Henry the Fifth with His Battell Fought at Agincourt in France
22.description: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

23.name: Phantom Lady
23.description: A devoted secretary risks her life to try to find the elusive woman who may prove her boss didn't murder his selfish wife.

24.name: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
24.description: In the wake of Pearl Harbor, a young lieutenant leaves his expectant wife to volunteer for a secret bombing mission which will take the war to the Japanese homeland.

25.name: Cover Girl
25.description: Rusty Parker wins a contest and becomes a celebrated cover girl; this endangers her romance with dancing mentor Danny.

26.name: This Happy Breed
26.description: Noël Coward's attempt to show how the ordinary people lived between the wars. Just after World War I, the Gibbons family moves to a nice house in the suburbs. An ordinary sort of life is ...                See full summary »

27.name: The Mummy's Ghost
27.description: An Egyptian priest travels to America in search of the bodies of an Egyptian princess and her living, mummified guardian, with consequences.

28.name: Die Feuerzangenbowle
28.description: A successful writer, home-schooled in his youth, masquerades as a student at a secondary school to experience all the fun and pranks he missed out on.

29.name: Mr. Skeffington
29.description: Popular and beautiful Fanny Trellis is forced into a loveless marriage with an older man, Jewish banker Job Skeffington, in order to save her beloved brother Trippy from an embezzlement charge, and predictable complications result.

30.name: The Lodger
30.description: A landlady suspects her new lodger is Jack the Ripper.

31.name: The Scarlet Claw
31.description: When a gentlewoman is found dead with her throat torn out, the villagers blame a supernatural monster. But Sherlock Holmes, who gets drawn into the case from nearby Quebec, suspects a human murderer.

32.name: Hollywood Canteen
32.description: Two soldiers on sick leave spend three nights at the Hollywood Canteen before going back to active duty. With a little friendly help from John Garfield, Slim gets to kiss Joan Leslie, whom ...                See full summary »

33.name: Tall in the Saddle
33.description: Ranch hand Rocklin arrives in town to start his new job but his employer has been murdered and the locals don't seem too friendly.

34.name: Between Two Worlds
34.description: Passengers on an ocean liner can't recall how they got on board or where they are going yet, oddly enough, it soon becomes apparent that they all have something in common.

35.name: A Canterbury Tale
35.description: Three modern day pilgrims investigate a bizarre crime in a small town on the way to Canterbury.

36.name: The Pearl of Death
36.description: When a valuable pearl with a sinister reputation is stolen, Sherlock Holmes must investigate its link to a series of brutal murders.

37.name: The Canterville Ghost
37.description: The descendent of a ghost imprisoned for cowardice hopes to free the spirit by displaying courage when under duress.

38.name: Ministry of Fear
38.description: Stephen Neale has just been released from an asylum during World War 2 in England when he stumbles on a deadly Nazi spy plot by accident, and tries to stop it.

39.name: The Mask of Dimitrios
39.description: Mystery writer Cornelius Leyden becomes intrigued when the murdered body of a vicious career criminal washes up in the Bosphorus.

40.name: The Suspect
40.description: An unhappily married man begins a flirtation with a younger woman. When his wife threatens to ruin her, he decides to take action.

41.name: The Thin Man Goes Home
41.description: Nick and Nora visit Nick's hometown, and end up involved in a murder.

42.name: Experiment Perilous
42.description: In 1903, a doctor suspects murder in the gothic Bederaux family.

43.name: The Keys of the Kingdom
43.description: A young priest, Father Chisholm is sent to China to establish a Catholic parish among the non-Christian Chinese. While his boyhood friend, also a priest, flourishes in his calling as a ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Seventh Cross
44.description: In Nazi Germany in 1936 seven men escape from a concentration camp. The camp commander puts up seven crosses and, as the Gestapo returns each escapee he is put to death on a cross. The ...                See full summary »

45.name: When Strangers Marry
45.description: A naive small-town girl comes to New York City to meet her husband, and discovers that he may be a murderer.

46.name: Lady in the Dark
46.description: Ginger Rogers, "Allure" magazines editor-in-chief, suffers from headaches and continuos daydreams and undergoes psychoanalysis to determine why.

47.name: One Body Too Many
47.description: An insurance investigator arrives at a creepy mansion to protect a millionaire who has had death threats made against him.

48.name: Cobra Woman
48.description: Upon discovering his fiancée Tollea has been kidnaped, Ramu and his friend Kado set out for a Pacific isle where all strangers are to be killed on arrival and the inhabitants, who are ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Way Ahead
49.description: World War II drama that follows a group of British draftees, starting with their rigorous basic training, and ending with their deployment in North Africa.

50.name: The Sullivans
50.description: The lives of a close-knit group of brothers growing up in Iowa during the days of the Great Depression and of World War II and their eventual deaths in action in the Pacific theater are ...                See full summary »
